section.title: Exclusion from node scope index
section.para: This example will exclude some 'text' property of the nt:unstructured node from indexing. Therefore, node will not be found by the content of this property, even if it accepts all constraints.
First of all, add rules to the indexing-configuration.xml file:
section.programlisting:
<index-rule nodeType="nt:unstructured" condition="@rule='nsiTrue'"> <!-- default value for nodeScopeIndex is true --> <property>text</property> </index-rule>
<index-rule nodeType="nt:unstructured" condition="@rule='nsiFalse'"> <!-- do not include text in node scope index --> <property nodeScopeIndex="false">text</property> </index-rule>
section.para: Repository contains the "nt:unstructured" nodes with the same 'text' property and different 'rule' properties (even null).

listitem.para: node1 (nt:unstructured) rule="nsiTrue" text="The quick brown fox ..."
node2 (nt:unstructured) rule="nsiFalse" text="The quick brown fox ..."
node3 (nt:unstructured) text="The quick brown fox ..." // as you see this node not mentioned in indexing-coniguration

section.para: NodeIterator will return "node1" and "node3". Node2, as you see, is not in result set.
